items.title: Ditch your bulky power bank while this wildly thin 10K aluminum model with built-in USB-C cable is down to $25
items.summary:
LISEN 10,000mAh slim power bank with built-in USB-C cable

Buy for $25 (Reg. $40)

What we love

This LISEN power bank measures just half an inch in thickness while still packing a 10,000mAh battery. It includes a built-in braided USB-C cable that doubles as a lanyard, so you don’t need to carry an extra wire. There’s no wireless charging, but you get reliable wired speeds up to 22.5W, plus a small display for battery status.

items.title: Half of all Sudanese children not in education due to civil war, says aid group
items.summary: GENEVA, Jan ‌22 (Reuters) - Around half of all school-age children in Sudan, or more than eight ‌million, are no longer in education because of the country's civil war, ‌in one of the world's worst education crises, Save The Children said in a report on Thursday. Read full story

items.title: Death toll from Spanish fatal train crash rises to 45
items.summary: MADRID, Jan. 22 (Xinhua) -- The death toll from Sunday's train crash in southern Spain has risen to 45 after Spanish Civil Guard officers discovered two additional bodies on Thursday. Read full story

items.title: Struggling fusion power company General Fusion to go public via $1B reverse merger
items.summary: General Fusion's merger with an acquisition company will net the company over $300 million. Just last year, the company ran into trouble raising money from other investors.

Both turntables include one-button automatic playback - which starts the turntable, raises and lowers the tonearm on the vinyl, and […]

items.title: Waymo continues robotaxi ramp up with Miami service now open to public

Chris Metinko / Axios:

Inferact, founded by the creators of vLLM to create a commercial AI product for cross-hardware efficiency, raised a $150M seed led by a16z at an $800M valuation  —  Inferact, an AI startup formed by the creators of open-source software vLLM, has raised $150 million in a seed funding round that values the company at $800 million.

items.title: Ireland proposes new law allowing police to use spyware
items.summary: The Irish government announced that it wants to pass a law that would grant police more surveillance powers, such as using spyware to fight serious crime, while aiming to protect the privacy rights of its citizens.

items.title: Austrian ex-intelligence accused of spying for Russia goes on trial

items.title: Autodesk plans to cut about 1,000 jobs, or ~7% of its workforce, as part of a global restructuring plan seeking to strengthen sales and marketing (Robb M. Stewart/Wall Street Journal)
items.summary:
Robb M. Stewart / Wall Street Journal:
Autodesk plans to cut about 1,000 jobs, or ~7% of its workforce, as part of a global restructuring plan seeking to strengthen sales and marketing  —  The move is the final phase of efforts by the maker of AutoCAD to streamline customer engagement and bolster its sales channels.

items.title: Google reportedly snags team behind AI voice startup Hume AI
items.summary: Google has hired the CEO and top engineer behind voice AI startup Hume AI, signaling that voice is increasingly becoming the preferred interface over screens.

items.title: Freezers full of seal meat: How Greenland's hunting culture helps emergency preparedness
items.summary: KAPISILLIT, Greenland, Jan 22 (Reuters) - While many Greenlanders ‌have been alarmed by U.S. President Donald Trump's demands to acquire their homeland, others such as ‌Kaaleeraq Ringsted have stayed calm, trusting in food stockpiles and traditional ways of life to navigate ‌the uncertainty. items.title: Vampire film Sinners breaks Oscar nominations record
items.summary: The horror is up for 16 awards - setting a new record for the most Oscar nominations for a single film.

items.title: Mozambique counts 13 dead in floods so far but toll expected to rise
items.summary: MAPUTO, Jan 22 (Reuters) - Mozambique authorities ‌on Thursday reported 13 deaths from severe floods over the past ‌two weeks, though the figure is expected to rise sharply, ‌with aid workers saying they expect more bodies to be found as waters recede. Read full story

items.title: Elizabeth Hurley tells UK court she endured 'brutal invasion of privacy'
items.summary: LONDON, Jan 22 (Reuters) - A ‌tearful Elizabeth Hurley said her landlines and home was bugged as part of a "brutal ‌invasion of privacy" to produce stories, as the actor gave evidence to the High ‌Court in London as part of high-profile privacy lawsuit against the Daily Mail. Read full story

items.title: From invisibility cloaks to AI chips: Neurophos raises $110M to build tiny optical processors for inferencing
items.summary: Neurophos is taking a crack at solving the AI industry's power efficiency problem with an optical chip that uses a composite material to do the math required in AI inferencing tasks.

items.title: Anthropic has to keep revising its technical interview test so you can’t cheat on it with Claude
items.summary: Since 2024, Anthropic's performance optimization team has given job seekers a take-home test to make sure they know their stuff — but as AI coding tools have gotten better, the test has had to change a lot to stay ahead of AI-assisted cheating.

items.title: Waymo launches its robotaxi service in Miami, its sixth market, initially covering a 60-square-mile area, and partners with Moove for fleet management (Lora Kolodny/CNBC)
items.summary:

Waymo launches its robotaxi service in Miami, its sixth market, initially covering a 60-square-mile area, and partners with Moove for fleet management  —  Alphabet's Waymo said Thursday that its robotaxi service is now open to paying riders in Miami, kicking off a 2026 market expansion.

items.title: Score Mario Bros. Wonder down at $47 before the Switch 2 Edition upgrade goes live
items.summary:
Today Nintendo announced the official release date for the new Super Mario Bros. Wonder – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition + Meetup in Bellabel Park alongside a new trailer. You can check that out right here, but we are also tracking a deal on the original Switch 1 version of Super Mario Bros. Wonder down at $46.99 Prime shipped via Woot. Regularly $60, this is the lowest price around and Nintendo has officially confirmed “you’ll be able to access the new content by purchasing an upgrade pack” today as well. It has confirmed the $20 price tag on the upgrade, and that means, much like the other Switch 2 Edition releases of Switch 1 games, you’ll be able to land the discounted copy here today and purchase the upgrade pack for less. 

These new features and more are available when Super Mario Bros. Wonder – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition + Meetup in Bellabel Park launches on March 26. If you already have the original Super Mario Bros. Wonder game and Nintendo Switch 2, you’ll be able to access the new content by purchasing an upgrade pack4. Pre-orders for the Super Mario Bros. Wonder upgrade pack begin today on My Nintendo Store and Nintendo eShop on Nintendo Switch 2.

This is regularly a $150 unit, which is currently fetching $111 at Amazon with a relatively lighter deal. Today’s deal at Woot, however, shaves an additional $26 off its usual going rate with a 43% markdown to land it $15 below its previous all-time low and our mention from September last year. This is the lowest price we have tracked for this waterproof Bluetooth speaker, and you can learn more about it in detail below.
